law.catch_line: Priority of security interests in transferred collateral.

text.section:
Except as otherwise provided in subsection (2) of this section, a security interest created by a debtor is subordinate to a security interest in the same collateral created by another person if:
The debtor acquired the collateral subject to the security interest created by the other person;
The security interest created by the other person was perfected when the debtor acquired the collateral; and
There is no period thereafter when the security interest is unperfected.

Subsection (1) of this section subordinates a security interest only if the security interest:
Otherwise would have priority solely under KRS 355.9-322(1) or 355.9-324; or
Arose solely under KRS 355.2-711(3) or 355.2A-508(5).

law.history: Created 2000 Ky. Acts ch. 408, sec. 65, effective July 1, 2001.
